mods.abstract: A one-page (front and back) handwritten letter by Clarence Jackson "Jack" Davis, to his parents, Mr. Benton V. Davis and Mrs. Mildred Jackson Davis, of Nashville, Tenn. Jack Davis joined the Marine Corps Reserve to help finance his education at Vanderbilt University. Within six months he found himself on the frontlines in Korea, in an infantry company bearing the ominous nickname "Bloody George." He wrote home to his family frequently, often daily. In this letter Davis describes improvements he made to his bunker to ensure better protection during combat. He includes a labeled sketch showing two different views of his safety-enhanced foxhole. Forms part of the Veterans History Project. 1 handwritten letter, with envelope.
